definition: to respect the wise and venerate the worthy (idiom); to honor the great and the good
to respect/to venerate/to salute/to offer

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation

sentences.english: Respect the elders, love juniors , save all with mercy, care for others.
sentences.chinese: 敬老尊贤，爱护后进，慈悲渡众，关怀他人。

sentences.english: Reverence for elders and veneration for virtuous ones has always been a wholesome tradition in China.
sentences.chinese: “敬老尊贤”一直是中国的优良传统。

definition: respect the aged
respect the old and cherish the young
respect for the aged
filial piety and fraternal duty
one's superior/one's elders and betters
to be well-mannered
sense of propriety, justice, integrity and honor (i.e. the four social bonds, 四維|四维[si4 wei2])
filial piety (Confucian virtue)/to be a good son or daughter
of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)
kindhearted and moderate (idiom); temperate and gentle
etiquette/(old) gradation of etiquette with social status
Confucian moral injunctions of fidelity/piety to one's parents, respect to one's older brother, loyalty to one's monarch, faith to one's male friends
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
affable and even-tempered
benevolence and righteousness
to be advanced in both years and virtue (idiom)
revered master
